text: James Jacob Ritty patented the first cash register as "Ritty's Incorruptible Cashier". He was motivated to invent it by the no-good thieving employees at his saloon.
Packard Motor Co. exhibited the first air-conditioned automobile at the 40th Automobile Show in Chicago, Illinois.

Fresh off census duty, the UNIVAC computer projected General Dwight David Eisenhower would defeat Adlai Stevenson for President of the US. All the polls showed Stevenson had a clear advantage so CBS delayed using the projection fearing inaccuracy.
